href="https://cocalc.com">;CoCalc</a>; 的直接产品之一竞争对手。今天（2023 年 11 月 30 日）<a href="https://deepnote.com/changelog/2023-11-30#reduced-machine-prices">;他们宣布大幅降价</a>; -you-go 费率：</p>; <blockquote>; <p>;<em>;“正如您可能已经听说的，从 12 月 1 日开始，我们将大幅削减所有机器的即用即付费率 – 使得它们对预算更友好，没有任何隐藏条款。”</em>;</p>; </blockquote>; <br>; <img>; <br>; <p>;在 CoCalc，我们最近<a href="https://github value = str（eval（expression））</code>;在幕后执行，结果显示在插件中。监视列表是一个非常强大的工具，但这是有代价的：表达式的任何副作用都会影响执行环境。</p>; <p>;表达式可以是</p>; <a href =“ https：// For this first post in the series I'll show that stochastic gradient descent (SGD) converges exponentially fast to a neighborhood of the solution. </p>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2021-12-10:/51204dae0a87bce1761f4867f01bb360f160f79c5d1c5e15388324d3754afb3b</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;A year of Jupyter community calls</stitle>;<updated>;2021-12-10T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/jupyter-community-calls"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;A lot of us showed up for the code, but hung around for the community. We'll continue this post talking about the monthly Jupyter community calls, and how they help all jovyans, Project Jupyter's pet name for their developers and users, stay connected.</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2021-11-17:/00cb5a62b3edf7d422e6a290fcf762ae89afdd784e7043a029b4a984e87c39f4</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;A vision for extensibility to GPU & distributed support for SciPy, scikit-learn, scikit-image and beyond</stitle>;<updated>;2021-11-17T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/pydata-extensibility-vision"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;In this post, we aim to articulate that vision and suggest a path to making it concrete, focusing on three libraries at the core of the PyData ecosystem: SciPy, scikit-learn and scikit-image.</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2021-11-07:/f237cf1c582061a16324a9344b3bc0c492db169642eaf9513682c383b34062ce</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;A bioinformatics training career panel in the DIB Lab</stitle>;<updated>;2021-11-07T23:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Living in an Ivory Basement</name>;<uri>;http://ivory.idyll.org/blog/</uri>;</author>;<link href="http://ivory.idyll.org/blog/2021-training-career-panel.html"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<p>;Careers in training!</p>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2021-11-03:/ff8b6206613156f4c74f69303565a7581654569eb2b93b90bb9c0c1e6a5f9a2b</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;NumPy Benchmarking</stitle>;<updated>;2021-11-03T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/numpy_benchmarking_blog"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;My work was majorly focused on providing performance benchmarks to NumPy in realistic situations.
